shake-up. Current Google CEO Eric Schmidt will serve as the company's executive chairman. Co-founder Sergey Brin will devote his time to strategic projects, in particular working on new products, the company said. We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time, Eric Schmidt said in a statement. plans to create 1,000 new jobs across the continent. In his keynote at the DLD Conference in Germany, Google's outgoing chief executive Eric Schmidt announced his company's intent to expand its European presence. Our businesses are doing very well around the globe, and as a result I'm happy to announce we'll be adding 1,000 new employees in Europe and make some significant investments, explained Eric Schmidt . "Hundreds of these people will be located right here in our technology center in Munich." In discussing such "significant investments," the former Google CEO outlined three main categories:
